COMMON_ABOUT_US:
Our Mission

Improving how STEM disciplines are communicated across the web, one blog post at a time.

About steemSTEM

SteemSTEM began as a small project dedicated to improving the quality of STEM (science, technology, engineering & mathematics) content on the Steem blockchain. However, as things unfolded, we realized that the importance of steemSTEM is greater than simply serving as curators for some niche topics on Steem.

The problem as we see it, has always been that those with the greatest knowledge of STEM subjects (*i.e.* researchers actively involved in groundbreaking research) lack incentive to communicate their work to mainstream audiences, leaving the majority of scientific reporting to journalists. As a result, only the most positive, groundbreaking and bizarre stories get heard, often becoming misinterpreted ‘fake news’ by mainstream media.

We at steemSTEM offer a different approach. We provide a space among a thriving global community of like-minded individuals where both experts and passionate STEM bloggers can freely distribute their knowledge in a social media environment that actively promotes and rewards honest, reliable and high-quality content.Inspired by the scientific method itself, SteemSTEM offers a three-layered system of review for each publication we promote:

  • Curators first read, review and have their decisions verified by a second curator.
  • A team of honor members scrutinizes the actions of curators, having rewards removed among other necessary actions.

  • Every promotion is open to the public who can further scrutinize and push for any necessary actions against misleading or fraudulent content that managed to pass through.This process means that SteemSTEM is one of the greatest spaces on the blockchain to find trustworthy, uncensored information that is both readable and enjoyable to be a part of.

    • SteemSTEM now offers content in 5 languages: English, French, German, Italian and Spanish.

COMMON_FAQ:
FAQs:

What is SteemSTEM?

Whilst initially aiming to improving the quality of STEM (science, technology, engineering & mathematics) content on the Steem blockchain, SteemSTEM, a community on the Steem blockchain, now targets to spread to usage of Steem for science communication. The overall goal of SteemSTEM is hence to create an environment where STEM professionals and enthusiasts alike are incentivised to elevate STEM communication to a new level, directly to the readers without the need of a third party.

Our community consists of scientists and STEM experts, science bloggers, developers, curators, collaborators and more, from all over the world. We all share ideas, work together or simply hang out in our discord server. We also share our daily actions (through announcements on our @steemstem blog on Steem and on our discord server) so anyone can, if needed, play an important part in contributing by rason his/her voice.

What does it mean to be a SteemTEM Member?

Though no 'membership' is required, by being part of our growing initiative, you get to both enjoy a community of like-minded individuals as well as contribute your own value in return via posts, discussions, comments and other forms of engagement.

My English is not so good, but I wish to write about STEM, what can I do?

SteemSTEM accepts content in multiple languages, with expected growth to come. To date, we curate content in English, Spanish, French, Italian, German and Serbian. Moreover, the SteemSTEM crew includes a team of mentors helping newcomers, both on the content side and on the language side.

How is a post evaluated for SteeSTEM support?

When curators find a potential post, they are looking for two things; objective and subjective quality. First, they may check your references and your image credits to make sure they are available to be used for commercial purposes. They may follow this with a plagiarism check.

If the curator is uncertain, they may view your profile and comment history and other aspects of your authorship. Once the post is deemed legitimate and original, they will decide subjectively what the post's value is to the community and the internet on the whole. This might involve originality, style, effort, creativity and more.

If the post is above our minimum vote, it must be double-checked by a second curator who may further check the above details before confirming the upvote. Our curation team decides on the voting strength a post should receive amongst four levels: small (encouragement and motivation), medium (informative post), standard (post that goes beyond providing information about a given topic) or high (discussion of state-of-the-art research, or something that cannot be found elsewhere).

But it doesn't end there. Our honor members are also on the case, making sure the curation team is not being lax in their job, finding problems the management otherwise missed and more.

If an illegitimate author manages to pass through this screening, the public can also view our curation history and highlight any mistakes we may have made, which, if sufficient evidence is provided, will cause rewards to be removed and for that author to be blacklisted from future curation. These users will not appear on the steemstem.io app.

How do I get curated?

The curators of SteemSTEM will primarily scour the '#steemstem' tag for related posts. This is the most likely place to be discovered. However, they will also go out into the wilderness of other STEM-related tags such as '#science,' '#biology,' '#chemistry', '#engineering' and more, in hopes to discover new content creators.

When it comes to curating a post, it will be added into the *curation channel* on our Discord server, which triggers the substantial voting trail to automatically upvote.

When should I use the SteemSTEM tag?

Whenever you write a post of an academic nature which meets the standards set by our guidelines. You may also use the tag if you simply want the community to consider or discuss a certain topic, or debate on related philosophy, for example.

My post is not upvoted, what now?

There is no post promotion channel. The SteemSTEM tag functions as such, so there is no need for another equivalent. If you haven't been upvoted, your post either fails to meet our standards or it has simply been missed. Curators are unfortunately all human, so this happens from time to time, and we suggest you just keep writing - for passion, not for money. If your posts are good, you will eventually be noticed.
